meanings.definition: Agreeing or accordant in opinion or action
meanings.sent1: The concurring friends all decided to watch the movie together.
meanings.sent2: The concurring group easily reached a consensus on the best restaurant to visit.
meanings.sent3: The concurring siblings always agreed on which games to play.
meanings.sent4: The concurring birds chirped in harmony, creating a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The concurring colors of the sunset painted the sky in a stunning display of unity.

meanings.sent1: The concurring events made it challenging to choose which one to attend.
meanings.sent2: The concurring meetings overlapped, causing a scheduling conflict.
meanings.sent3: The concurring alarms rang simultaneously, startling everyone awake.
meanings.sent4: The concurring thunder and lightning filled the sky with a powerful display of nature's might.
meanings.sent5: The concurring waves crashed against the shore in a rhythmic dance of simultaneous motion.

meanings.sent1: I am concurring with your proposal for the new project.
meanings.sent2: The data is concurring with our initial hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The stars seem to be concurring with your wish tonight.
meanings.sent4: His actions are concurring with his words, showing true integrity.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast is concurring with what we observed outside.
